content.1: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came into the land of the people of the east.
content.2: And he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there
content.3: And thither were all the flocks gathered: and they rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again upon the well’s mouth in his place.
content.4: And Jacob said unto them, My brethren, whence
content.5: And he said unto them, Know ye Laban the son of Nahor? And they said, We know
content.8: And they said, We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and
content.9: And while he yet spake with them, Rachel came with her father’s sheep: for she kept them.
content.10: And it came to pass, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother’s brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother’s brother.
content.11: And Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.
content.12: And Jacob told Rachel that he
content.13: And it came to pass, when Laban heard the tidings of Jacob his sister’s son, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. And he told Laban all these things.
content.14: And Laban said to him, Surely thou
content.15: And Laban said unto Jacob, Because thou
content.16: And Laban had two daughters: the name of the elder
content.18: And Jacob loved Rachel; and said, I will serve thee seven years for Rachel thy younger daughter.
content.20: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed unto him
content.21: And Jacob said unto Laban, Give
content.22: And Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
content.23: And it came to pass in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.
content.24: And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah his maid
content.25: And it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it
content.26: And Laban said, It must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.
content.27: Fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the service which thou shalt serve with me yet seven other years.
content.28: And Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him Rachel his daughter to wife also.
content.29: And Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah his handmaid to be her maid.
content.30: And he went in also unto Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.
content.32: And Leah conceived, and bare a son, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Surely the
content.33: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Because the
content.34: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and said, Now this time will my husband be joined unto me, because I have born him three sons: therefore was his name called Levi.
